\doxysubsection{Detailed Description}
Class that represents a Linux Socket\+CAN address. 

This inherits from the CAN form of a socket address, {\itshape sockaddr\+\_\+can}.

bool sockpp\+::can\+\_\+address\+::is\+\_\+set (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}{}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption}) const\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}, {\ttfamily [override]}, {\ttfamily [virtual]}, {\ttfamily [noexcept]}}



Checks if the address is set to some value. 

This doesn\textquotesingle{}t attempt to determine if the address is valid, simply that it\textquotesingle{}s not all zero. \begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
{\itshape true} if the address has been set, {\itshape false} otherwise. 
\end{DoxyReturn}

Gets the size of the address structure.
